verse56.explanation: Krishna assures that those who are devoted to Him and take refuge in Him, even while performing worldly duties, will attain eternal liberation.
verse56.sanskrit: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः। मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम्॥

verse57.english: Cetasā sarva-karmāṇi mayi saṁnyasya mat-paraḥ। Buddhi-yogam upāśritya mac-cittaḥ satataṁ bhava॥
verse57.explanation: Krishna advises Arjuna to dedicate all actions to Him, make Him the ultimate goal, and engage in the yoga of wisdom while keeping his mind always on Krishna.
verse57.sanskrit: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः। बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव॥

verse58.english: Mac-cittaḥ sarva-durgāṇi mat-prasādāt tariṣyasi। Atha cet tvam ahaṅkārān na śroṣyasi vinaṅkṣyasi॥
verse58.explanation: By surrendering to Krishna and focusing on Him, one can overcome all challenges; otherwise, ego and ignorance lead to downfall.
verse58.sanskrit: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि। अथ चेत्त्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि॥

verse59.english: Yad ahaṅkāram āśritya na yotsya iti manyase। Mithyaiṣa vyavasāyas te prakṛtis tvāṁ niyokṣyati॥
verse59.explanation: Arjuna’s nature as a warrior will compel him to fight, regardless of his current reluctance due to ego and confusion.
verse59.sanskrit: यदहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे। मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति॥

verse60.english: Svabhāva-jena kaunteya nibaddhaḥ svena karmaṇā। Kartuṁ necchasi yan-mohāt kariṣyasy avaśo'pi tat॥
verse60.explanation: Arjuna is reminded that his inherent duty as a warrior will drive him to act, even if he resists due to delusion.
verse60.sanskrit: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा। कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत्॥

verse61.english: Īśvaraḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ hṛd-deśe'rjuna tiṣṭhati। Bhrāmayan sarva-bhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā॥
verse61.explanation: Krishna explains that the Divine resides in the hearts of all beings, controlling their actions and destiny through Maya, the power of illusion.
verse61.sanskrit: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति। भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया॥

verse62.english: Tam eva śaraṇaṁ gaccha sarva-bhāvena bhārata। Tat-prasādāt parāṁ śāntiṁ sthānaṁ prāpsyasi śāśvatam॥
verse62.explanation: Krishna urges Arjuna to surrender completely to the Divine, promising that this will lead to eternal peace and liberation.
verse62.sanskrit: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत। तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम्॥

verse63.english: Iti te jñānam ākhyātaṁ guhyaād guhyataraṁ mayā। Vimṛśyaitad aśeṣeṇa yathecchasi tathā kuru॥
verse63.explanation: After revealing the highest knowledge, Krishna gives Arjuna the freedom to choose his own path, emphasizing the importance of free will.
verse63.sanskrit: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया। विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु॥

verse64.english: Sarva-guhya-tamaṁ bhūyaḥ śṛṇu me paramaṁ vacaḥ। Iṣṭo'si me dṛḍham iti tato vakṣyāmi te hitam॥
verse64.explanation: Krishna, out of deep affection for Arjuna, offers him the highest and most confidential teaching for his ultimate benefit.
verse64.sanskrit: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः श्रृणु मे परमं वचः। इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम्॥

verse65.english: Man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru। Mām evaiṣyasi satyaṁ te pratijāne priyo'si me॥
verse65.explanation: Krishna urges Arjuna to focus his mind on Him, be devoted, and surrender to Him, promising that this will lead to union with the Divine.
verse65.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु। मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे॥

verse66.english: Sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śaraṇaṁ vraja। Ahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ॥
verse66.explanation: Krishna’s ultimate instruction is to abandon all other duties and take refuge in Him alone, promising liberation from all sins and sorrow.
verse66.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥

verse67.english: Idaṁ te nātapaskāya nābhaktāya kadācana। Na cāśu-śrūṣave vācyaṁ na ca māṁ yo'bhya-sūyati॥
verse67.explanation: The teachings of the Gita should be shared only with those who are sincere, devoted, and free from envy, as they require a certain level of purity and dedication.
verse67.sanskrit: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन। न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति॥

verse68.english: Ya imaṁ paramaṁ guhyaṁ mad-bhakteṣv abhidhāsyati। Bhaktiṁ mayi parāṁ kṛtvā mām evaiṣyaty asaṁśayaḥ॥
verse68.explanation: Krishna promises that those who share the teachings of the Gita with His devotees, out of pure devotion, will attain union with Him.
verse68.sanskrit: य इमं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति। भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः॥

verse69.english: Na ca tasmān manuṣyeṣu kaścin me priya-kṛttamaḥ। Bhavitā na ca me tasmād anyaḥ priyataro bhuvi॥
verse69.explanation: Krishna expresses that those who spread His teachings are the dearest to Him, emphasizing the importance of sharing divine knowledge.
verse69.sanskrit: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः। भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि॥

verse70.english: Adhyeṣyate ca ya imaṁ dharmyaṁ saṁvādam āvayoḥ। Jñāna-yajñena tenāham iṣṭaḥ syām iti me matiḥ॥
verse70.explanation: Krishna considers the study of the Gita as an act of worship, equivalent to performing a sacrifice of knowledge, pleasing to Him.
verse70.sanskrit: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः। ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः॥

verse71.english: Śraddhāvān anasūyaś ca śṛṇuyād api yo naraḥ। So'pi muktaḥ śubhān lokān prāpnuyāt puṇya-karmaṇām॥
verse71.explanation: Hearing the Gita with faith and sincerity also grants liberation and access to the realms of the virtuous.
verse71.sanskrit: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च श्रृणुयादपि यो नरः। सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम्॥

verse72.english: Kaccid etac chrutaṁ pārtha tvayaikāgreṇa cetasā। Kaccid ajñāna-saṁmohaḥ pranaṣṭas te dhanañjaya॥
verse72.explanation: Krishna asks Arjuna if he has listened attentively and if his confusion and ignorance have been dispelled.
verse72.sanskrit: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा। कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय॥

verse73.english: Arjuna uvāca। Naṣṭo mohaḥ smṛtir labdhā tvat-prasādān mayācyuta। Sthito'smi gata-sandehaḥ kariṣye vacanaṁ tava॥
verse73.explanation: Arjuna acknowledges that his confusion has been dispelled by Krishna’s teachings, and he is now ready to fulfill his duty without hesitation.
verse73.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत। स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव॥

verse74.english: Sañjaya uvāca। Ity ahaṁ vāsudevasya pārthasya ca mahātmanaḥ। Saṁvādam imam aśrauṣam adbhutaṁ roma-harṣaṇam॥
verse74.explanation: Sanjaya expresses his awe and reverence for the divine conversation between Krishna and Arjuna, which has deeply moved him.
verse74.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच। इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः। संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम्॥

verse75.english: Vyāsa-prasādāc chrutavān etad guhyam ahaṁ param। Yogaṁ yogeśvarāt kṛṣṇāt sākṣāt kathayataḥ svayam॥
verse75.explanation: Sanjaya credits the sage Vyasa for blessing him with the ability to hear the divine teachings of Krishna directly.

verse76.english: Rājan saṁsmṛtya saṁsmṛtya saṁvādam imam adbhutam। Keśavārjunayoḥ puṇyaṁ hṛṣyāmi ca muhur muhuḥ॥
verse76.explanation: Sanjaya finds great joy in repeatedly recalling the holy conversation between Krishna and Arjuna.
verse76.sanskrit: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम्। केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः॥

verse77.english: Tac ca saṁsmṛtya saṁsmṛtya rūpam aty-adbhutam hareḥ। Vismayo me mahān rājan hṛṣyāmi ca punaḥ punaḥ॥
verse77.explanation: Sanjaya is overwhelmed with awe and joy as he recalls Krishna's divine form.
verse77.sanskrit: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः। विस्मयो मे महान् राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः॥

verse78.english: Yatra yogeśvaraḥ kṛṣhṇo yatra pārtho dhanur-dharaḥ। Tatra śhīr-vijayo bhūtir dhruvā nītir matir mama॥
verse78.explanation: Sanjaya concludes that wherever Krishna and Arjuna are present, there will always be success, righteousness, and prosperity.
verse78.sanskrit: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः। तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम॥
